abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan would support
            deepening of the Government's program of industrial
            policy reform aimed at providing additional support to
            efficient export-oriented industries, while gradually
            phasing out the incentives offered to inefficient import
            substitution enterprises. Specific measures have already
            been taken to reduce protection and increase efficiency in
            import substitution manufacturing. Measures to be
            implemented under the program include: a) reduction of
            maximum tariffs on imports from preferential sources, from
            600 percent to 127 percent before effectiveness, and to 107
            percent before release of the second tranche. The measures
            further include b) adoption of a program for the
            simplification of the tariff schedule; c) discontinuation of
            the incentive scheme for import substituting enterprises; d)
            improvements in the design and functioning of the drawback
            system for exporters; and e) reduction in the number of
            items under price controls. The foreign exchange provided by
            the loan would be used to finance the CIF cost of a wide
            range of imports.
